Plant_Information: An apple is an edible fruit produced by an apple tree. Apple trees are cultivated worldwide and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus. The tree originated in Central Asia, where its wild ancestor, Malus sieversii, is still found today.
Plant_pros: Nutritious, May Support Weight loss, Good for your heart, Prevent Cancer, Easy to grow, Quick growing tree once established
Plant_cons: Full sized trees need a lot of space, You may need more than one tree for pollination, Can have issues with pests or fungal infections

Plant_Information: Arjuna grows to about 20–25 metres tall usually has a buttressed trunk, and forms a wide canopy at the crown, from which branches drop downwards. It has oblong, conical leaves which are green on the top and brown below
Plant_pros: It promotes heart health, Gigh in antioxidants, May aid blood sugar control, May reduce cancer risk
Plant_cons: It can cause nausea, headaches, body aches, and constipation

Plant_Information: Bel or Bael in Hindi, and as wood apple, stone apple, Bengal quince, Indian quince, holy fruit or golden apple in English, is an important medicinal tree in India. Bael trees are found growing in abundance in the Himalayan regions, Bengal, Central and South India, as well as in Srilanka, Burma, Thailand, Bangladesh, Nepal, Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, and Pakistan.
Plant_pros: It can cure Constipation, Depression, Diabetes, Diarrhea, Snake bite, Stomach Ache
Plant_cons: It might lower blood sugar levels so, Stop using bael at least 2 weeks before a scheduled surgery.

Plant_Information: Basil also called great basil, is a culinary herb of the family Lamiaceae (mints). In Western cuisine, the generic term "basil" refers to the variety also known as sweet basil or Genovese basil which is native to tropical regions from Central Africa to Southeast Asia
Plant_pros: It can be benefitial in Intestinal gas, Stomach spasms, Kidney disorders, Worms, Blood circulation, Snake and Insect Bites.
Plant_cons: It might slow blood clotting and increase bleeding. It can also lower blood pressure

Plant_Information: Blueberries are a widely distributed and widespread group of perennial flowering plants with blue or purple berries. They are classified in the section Cyanococcus within the genus Vaccinium. Vaccinium also includes cranberries, bilberries, huckleberries and Madeira
Plant_pros: They are delicious, nutritious, Low on glycemic index and alos have large amounts of nutrients
Plant_cons: They can affect blood sugar levels, can interfere with surgery and may have pesticides

Plant_Information: A cherry is the fruit of many plants of the genus Prunus, and is a fleshy drupe.
Plant_pros: They're high in nutrients, rich in antioxidants, can boost exercise recovery.
Plant_cons: Excessive consumption can cause intestinal gas, bloating and cramps.

Plant_Information: Chinar trees characteristically grow in Eastern Himalayas. Their botanical name is Platanus orientalis. They have been an important part of Kashmiri tradition
Plant_pros:
The twigs and barks have extensive uses in making fabric dyes.
The timber, which is also known as lacewood, is popular in making furniture. Leaves and bark of the tree have multiple uses in the preparation of medicines
Plant_cons: It might cause queasiness, dizziness, headache, and diarrhea.

Plant_Information: Corn is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family. The best-known species is Z. mays (variously called maize, corn, or Indian corn), one of the most important crops for human societies throughout much of the world.
Plant_pros: It prevents haemorrhoids, promotes weight gain, provides minerals.
Plant_cons: It has extremely high amounts of fatty acids and therefore should be consumed with caution. People who are generally at risk of heart diseases

Plant_Information: Guava is a common tropical fruit cultivated in many tropical and subtropical regions. The common guava Psidium guajava is a small tree in the myrtle family (Myrtaceae), native to Mexico, Central America
Plant_pros: It May Help Lower Blood Sugar Levels, May Boost Heart Health, May Help Relieve Painful Symptoms of Menstruation, Benefit Your Digestive System
Plant_cons: Its extract contains chemicals that can cause skin irritation, especially in people with skin conditions like eczema. If you have eczema, use guava leaf.

Plant_Information: It is a genus of 79 accepted species of vining plants in the flowering plant family Vitaceae. Most cultivated Vitis varieties
Plant_pros: It can be benefitial in preventing Cancer, Heart health, Blood pressure.
Plant_cons: Eating large quantities of it might cause diarrhea. Some people have allergic reactions to it and its products. Some other side effects might include cough, dry mouth, and headache.

Plant_Information: is an evergreen tropical tree in the flowering plant family Myrtaceae, and favored for its fruit, timber, and ornamental value. It is native to the Indian Subcontinent

Plant_Information: Jatropha is a genus of flowering plants in the spurge family, Euphorbiaceae. It contains approximately 170 species of succulent plants.

Plant_Information: The pomegranate (Punica granatum) is a fruit-bearing deciduous shrub in the family Lythraceae, subfamily Punicoideae, that grows between 5 and 10 m (16 and 33 ft) tall.

Plant_Information: Millettia pinnata is a legume tree that grows to about 15–25 m (50–80 ft) in height with a large canopy that spreads equally wide. It may be deciduous for short periods.

Plant_Information: The potato is a starchy tuber of the plant Solanum tuberosum and is a root vegetable native to the Americas. The plant is a perennial in the nightshade family Solanaceae.
Plant_pros: They are good source of fiber, which can help you lose weight by keeping you full longer

Plant_Information: The raspberry is the edible fruit of a multitude of plant species in the genus Rubus of the rose family.

Plant_Information: The soybean, soy bean, or soya bean (Glycine max) is a species of legume native to East Asia, widely grown for its edible bean, which has numerous uses.

Plant_Information: Alstonia scholaris is a glabrous tree and grows up to 40 m (130 ft) tall. Its mature bark is grayish and its young branches are copiously marked with lenticels.
